basics.name: Sigmund Waldfürst
basics.label: Senior Prompt Engineer
basics.summary: Curious tinkerer passionate about FOSS, privacy, and simple, elegant systems. Builds cool things with code and text.

work.name: Prompt Labs Inc.
work.summary: Leading the design of powerful and efficient prompts for AI models in creative, technical, and strategic contexts.
highlights: Built a modular prompt framework used across multiple internal tools.
Championed FOSS practices within AI prompt pipelines.

work.name: Prompt Labs Inc.
work.summary: Crafted prompts to improve LLM output in coding, summarization, and reasoning tasks.
highlights: Developed a prompt tuning system for knowledge retrieval tasks.
Collaborated with product teams to design user-facing prompt interfaces.

work.name: Federal Bureau of Control (FBC)
work.summary: Assisted in the stabilization and classification of newly discovered Altered Items, with a focus on linguistic anomalies and cognitohazardous materials.
highlights: Developed internal tooling for tracking semantic drift in shifting object documentation.
Deployed emergency prompts to contain a memetic outbreak in Sector ███, preventing Class 3 escalation.

volunteer.summary: Digitized and preserved lost expedition logs from the 1930-31 Antarctic research missions, using shell scripts and OCR tooling to restore fragmented documentation.
highlights: Recovered over 5,000 lines of corrupted expedition metadata from decaying media.
Built a searchable terminal-based index system for cryptic glyphs and ancient cartographic scans.

awards.title: Director’s Ribbon of Extraordinary Action
awards.summary: Awarded for exceptional performance and improvisational prompt engineering during the 'Cascade Loop Incident,' which caused recursive documentation and localized timestream corruption in the Containment Wing.

publications.name: Cryptic Interfaces: UX Patterns in the Prehuman Archives
publications.summary: A short speculative paper analyzing the interaction patterns of the Elder Things' stone tablet systems, drawing parallels with modal text editors and UNIX.

projects.name: morandi.nvim
projects.description: A Neovim colorscheme inspired by the soft tones of Giorgio Morandi’s paintings.

projects.name: epic-games-notifier
projects.description: A simple tool to get notified about free games on Epic Store.

references.name: Prof. William Dyer
references.reference: Sigmund is a brilliant engineer whose grasp of the ineffable intricacies of symbolic systems surpasses even the academics of Miskatonic. I trust them implicitly with both cognition loops and eldritch interfaces.
